page.title: 05VIEWS FROM FLEETWOOD MOUNT.
page.content: by Vikki Taylor, aged 10. My grandparents told me that the town crest,{ONWARD},in front of the Mount pavilion, long ago used to be made up of flowering plants but you could go into the pavilion to see the Mount clock working and step out onto the verandah to view the scenery. The Mount cottage which is now used by the Citizens Advice Bureau used to be a family house and the family had to cross the passage to go to their bedrooms.There were rose gardens in front of an outdoor swimming pool and by the paddling pool was a wooden hut where daily puppet shows were given in the summer. In the pavilion by the rose garden, summer shows were given, and there was a roundabout where the car park is now. Even so, my grandparents still enjoy the view from Fleetwood's Mount.
